review:
This app is so good, it’s almost perfect. It has nutrition, activity, water, and measurement tracking, plus a notes section with a good variety of tags that serve as a mood journal/symptom tracker of sorts. With pro, I also have Fitbit integration and a fasting tracker. Put that all together and this app really meets all of my needs and took 2-3 apps out of my rotation, all replaced by this one. 

I only say it’s almost perfect because I would love two things, they’re minor but would be great. I would love to have more flexibility in the fasting schedules/tracking. Nothing longer than 16:8 is kinda on the light side for people who are already used to regular IF. An option to input a custom fasting schedule would be perfect but the addition of 18:6 and 20:4/OMAD (one meal a day) would be fantastic. ADF (alternate day fasting) is not my jam but they have several options for that as well, though I can’t attest to the variety.

The other thing that would be great is an increased variety of tags in the Note section. Again the option to add custom ones would be marvelous but just more tags so that I can track a wider breadth of moods and symptoms would be helpful.
title: Amazing!!!

your YAZIO team

review:
I’ve used a few calorie counter apps before, and this one seemed good at first. However, there are a few options that are not user friendly. I have the free version so they may be better on the subscription version.
 But, for one it’s hard to determine exactly where it is deriving the caloric limit from and it doesn’t automatically update with weight loss or gain, you must manually recalculate each time. Then, it doesn’t tell you the exact calories you have expended for the day (even wearing an Apple Watch), it just gives you a goal to burn each day based on information entered in to the bio. 
I have yet to determine what the color of the circle for each day indicates since there is no explanation for that. 
Also, I’ve yet to come across any of my foods that have the barcode information entered into their food database. A lot of the foods I'm scanning are common foods.  It’s extremely time consuming and frustrating to have to enter all the information about every ingredient in each meal in manually. It also only gives a few options for serving sizes instead of multiple options. Most of the serving sizes on the packaging of my foods don’t even match up with one of the serving size options given. 
Lastly, the app crashes on my iPhone X every time I try to search for a food. This is by far the most frustrating issue I’ve had with it. If it crashes every time I try to enter my food, how am I supposed to actually track my calories?
title: Not ready for the iPhone X

review:
This app is great and it is an excellent multi-tracking tool for overall wellness. I love that it syncs to my watch. I was so impressed with the quality of it that I only had it a day before choosing to upgrade to the membership.
However, with that being said, there are a few small issues. I tried to find a way to reach out to the dev team or request to beta test in order to address or troubleshoot these issues, but couldn’t find that. My first issue is that the watch app of YAZIO always presents an error when trying to sign up or sign in, specifically through Apple ID, which is what I’m signed up with on my phone app. It still connects to my Health data, but I want to access the app on my wrist too. The second issue is part of why I opted into a membership, so it’s disappointing it isn’t working- the Health/Food Coach option to create my own meal plan always presents a 404 error no matter what options are chosen. The last issue might not be a YAZIO issue (possibly a Siri issue), but the Siri shortcuts don’t seem to do anything.
Overall, I’m still happy with my purchase bc it’s super easy to monitor so many aspects of my food intake, water, and activity while being easy-to-understand.
title: Close to perfect! A few small issues though…

review: I don’t usually write reviews but I am truly impressed by this app and felt I should give credit where credit is due. This is by far the best diet aid app I have found and I’ve been through many trying to find the perfect one. It has everything you need all in one and there’s no hidden charges like others. What I especially like about this app is their extensive recipes, one thing I struggle with as an athlete is getting enough, good, calories and the recipes have helped tremendously as they are all light wholesome ingredients (perfect for an active lifestyle). Another great aspect is their new addition for notes so that way you can track how you are feeling if you are in a new diet or if you just want to decompress. There are so many meal plan options so you can choose what is right for you or just track what you are already doing!:) facts
title: THE BEST (not biased I stg)

developerResponse.body: Thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback. Would you mind please getting in touch with our support team at: request.yazio.com, describing your issue in more detail, and sending screenshots? That way we can look into your problem further and try to help you find a solution. Thank you for your cooperation! Kind regards, Your YAZIO-Team

review:
I got a new phone and downloaded YAZIO which I paid subscription till May but on new phone it won’t let me see recipes.  I can’t find away to contact, at first it wouldn’t let me log in and when I would request help with password you all would not send password.  So I had to dig through my passwords till I found it so it loaded info from profile but not completely correctly I had to go in an edit plus it didn’t load any old data.

As far as the app goes I prefer my fitness pal.  This has a lot of incorrect data if you compare nutritional data on packaging to app.  Plus if you try to input new food a lot of times it will give you a stupid message (I can’t remember exactly how it’s worded) but essentially it tells you nutritional data doesn’t add up to serving.  I feel my fitness pal is more user friendly.  The only thing I like better is the note section so you can track moods or health from day to day.  Oh and calories burnt don’t match with other sources, I tried to online sources and a book, at least 2 of them match but rarely does YAZIO info match.  At first I thought maybe I will like it better if I use it longer, I’m on my second year because I forgot to cancel subscription before it was deducted but like I mentioned before I can’t use recipes on new phone so if not correctly I have no reason to continue with this app.
title: YAZIO is huge headache

review:
First the good. I like the water tracker. I am definitely drinking more water because of this app. I like how you can see all the nutritional info easily for each meal. This was more difficult with MyFitnessPal.  They have a FB support and the people are super supportive and helpful in that group.  

The not so good. Adding a recipe had to be done manually. You can’t import one from the web like you can with MyFitnessPal. I am not sure I trust their calorie calculator. There is a coaching app to support intermittent fasting and offer different challenges. This would be good except it doesn’t work well for vegans or vegetarians. It includes lots of menu suggestions and recipes but not for vegans. There are a few vegan recipes but there are not very good. Would not make again. The whole coaching aspect is bad for me because it keeps telling me to eat animals (vegan for 20 years). 

Bottom line, what I paid the extra money for is useless for vegans and vegetarians. Only benefit over MyFitnessPal is the water tracker. If I knew that I would have saved my money.
title: Not great for vegans and vegetarians

review: I started this app as a slim 17 year old kid getting ready to go to college. My goal has always been to play lacrosse at Syracuse and this app is helping me immensely. I set my goal to building muscle as I started as an athletic but still somewhat scrawny kid. I started at 135 and set my goal weight for 155 to start. With the help of this app, I have been able to get the proper amount of calories I need for my goal AND I get a step counter and calories burned counter. This app does all the math for me and I am no longer struggling with my calorie counting like I was before this app. In 2 weeks I have gained almost 6 pounds of almost 100% pure muscle. This app has made it easy to meet daily goals with reminders and helpful tools throughout the app. The recipe ideas are also helpful even if you don’t have the pro membership.
title: Life changer

review:
I’m trying this after being a MyFitnessPal user for a long time. The things I really like about this are (1) it makes really good use of its Apple Watch app, way more than MyFitnessPal, and (2) it’s a much cleaner look. With MyFitnessPal I always hated how the initial screen was basically an ad for their other products, despite having paid for the full subscription. 

The downside of YAZIO is that the database doesn’t seem as full, although so far it has been pretty good. The bigger frustration I’ve run into is that when I tried to add foods that weren’t in the database I got an error saying that my calories didn’t match what the macronutrients were, despite the fact that they were definitely what the label said. 

At $22 per year so far it’s definitely been worth trying out. They also have a lot of different diet options with food recommendations, which I’ll be checking out after the holidays.
title: New from MyFitnessPal

review:
The good: interface, doesn’t push fad diets (but supports them, you Keto people), nice recipes section.

The neutral: pro version cost, database needs work (but works well enough, and doesn’t play games with serving sizes so far)

The bad: calorie calculation for goals. Oof, this one is a big one. If you’re the kind of person who has success with straight calorie tracking as opposed to food category restriction (which is just a convoluted way to get to calorie restriction), then you should be familiar with BMR calculations.

My BMR is about 2500 Calories when sedentary, and and activity beyond that raises my caloric needs. This app adds movement Calories from Apple Watch, Fitbit etc. That’s great! But... they add movement Calories into your baseline!

What does this mean? If I want to lose 1lb a week, I should be eating 2000 Calories plus more for movement. But this app starts me at 2500 and THEN adds my movement Calories. So if so burn 500 on average, this app says I should eat 3000... or 3500 if I want to maintain weight.

You can set caloric goals manually, but if you’re going to try counting calories with this app, you’re going to maintain or gain weight, not lose. This app isn’t the only one to do this, but given how good the interface is for straight calorie counters... it’s just frustrating.

So just don’t rely on their Calorie goal calculator, do a BMR calculation online and remember 500C/day is 1lb/week, then go from there.
title: Bad calculations

review:
The good: it’s fairly extensive in regards to information and nutrient break-out. For many processed foods, it offers a simple barcode scanner to import nutrition info. 

The bad: too many options for a single item. Look up something like ‘egg’ and you get so many options, including distinctions like brand. The nutritional info is different among the options as well. 

Also, you may find several choices for the same frozen dinner - with different values, apparently based on whatever users submit. 

Navigating the myriad of options is very frustrating. 

As for support - I used the app for a few weeks before deciding to purchase the pro version. I used the pro features for a few weeks when suddenly all of my info was gone. Support took almost a week to respond and told me that because I didn’t register when I first downloaded the app, my purchase ended up wiping everything out. They did not address the fact I had been using the app for a few weeks under my pro subscription. 

So now I have to start all over - and, of course, give them all my information to track me with and/or sell to marketers.

I’ll use it for now, but will be looking for something with more accurate nutritional info and fewer than a dozen options to say ‘I ate an egg.’
title: Extensive, but confusing and poor support

developerResponse.body: Hi John, thanks so much for your feedback! To review suggestions, we recently launched a website: https://feedback-en.yazio.com/. Would be happy to receive your suggestion there! Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review:
I was a long-term user of another popular calorie tracking app, but found myself looking for an app that synced better with other tracking apps. Enter YAZIO. So far, I find the app absolutely fantastic. The UI is clean and simple, the tracking feels accurate, and the logging is very nice. I’m starting to feel like a permanent convert!

However, there is one significant issue: the “Add Food” capability. It certainly makes sense that the food library is smaller than some apps that have been on the market longer. I can’t fault them for that, and have been more than willing to take the time to add foods to their library that I eat and can find the nutritional info for. The issue is that there’s no way to “name” a standard serving. This makes adding food, or logging food another user added, extremely difficult.

I understand that it’s oz based, but some menus don’t provide caloric info based on the oz’s of, say, rolls. They tell you how many calories are in a roll! If they offered the user the chance to rename a “standard portion” to something more useful (for example, “1 Roll”) it’d make the database so much more useful!

Other than that, the app is fantastic, but this ends up being a bit of a deal breaker. I don’t want to have to add custom foods every time because I can’t figure out what other uses used for their “standard portion” baseline.
title: Need Better “Add Food” Support

review: This is a great app and honestly it would deserve a 5 star rating. I really enjoy it, I’m eating healthier and seeing results just after a week of using it, BUT that’s because I realized of the tons of mistakes other users have made when entering nutrition facts into the database, and I’ve spent quite a deal of time entering my own data. The app allows you to create food items entering any name for any kind of food with almost any nutrition facts and share that data publicly. It seems no one is checking all this data, resulting on a public database with lots of duplicated items, different nutrition facts for the same item, and misleading info. The developer must create an efficient way for users to report wrong information and remove those items from the database. Bottom line, a really good app if you’re using your own data.
title: Food Database Needs A Lot of Work Ahead

review: I was using MyFitnessPal for years and thought I’d try this because I don’t want to just know the calories, but also want to know the quality of the food that matches my goals.  This seemed like the perfect fit at first.  As I have been using it (in USA) I have found the food database to be woefully lacking.  It has nothing to do with barcodes or barcode reader, the foods aren’t in the database.  Some very common foods from any chain restaurant are missing.  I have to add almost EVERY item manually.  That’s a non-starter after having used MyFitnessPal and never having this issue.  Like other comments, everything seems to be listed as a 1 ounce serving size.  Not very helpful when dealing with grapes, avocados, etc.  The app has great potential, but too labor intensive to get the information into the app.  I’ll keep looking for an app like MyFitnessPal that has the food quality ratings like this one if it exists.
title: Needs a much larger food database!

review: I wish there had been a free trial available before purchasing a subscription. I chose this out of all the apps because it was the only one that counted both fasting and calories. I was excited to see that there was an updated version which was supposed to address some of the issues I am having. It states that the updated version allows you to customize your fast times. It either does not or I can’t figure out how to do it. You cannot enter your meal times. The time for the 16:8 skip dinner fast automatically runs from 2:00 pm to 6:00 am. I am not even up at 6:00 am. The most frustrating part of the app is the calorie counter. It is so random. For example, a cup of grapes is listed as 350 calories. Even foods identified by brand are wrong. Not even standard measurements are correct. Sometimes a cup is listed as 4 oz sometimes 3.5, sometimes something else. Last time I checked, a cup is 8 oz. The whole thing is clunky. The only thing I do like is the estimation of weeks left until the weight goal is reached.
title: So disappointed

review: I found the app as a recommendation on IOS 15 health. Thanks Apple!  I am 64 and have seen drastic weight gain with complications lately. I first fasted in 1975 with great success but now metabolism is not what it used to be. I loose confidence as my body reacts differently. This app supports and encourages as the days go by. I am now able to lean into the hunger like it’s a wind in my face each day with confidence and use data points it supplies to encourage me. Say to myself; see there you can do this. I fly by the 12 hour fasting clock and frequently extend it with jubilation. Only beef ( yum beef) is it doesn’t remind me to start or stop fasting clock. You need to do this and you’ll thank these people for writing such a good app. And pay the $33 for subscription, you need some skin in the game.
title: Nice

review:
I enjoy the look of the app and the options it has, unfortunately despite working with YAZIO support team, they don’t seem to understand as a whole the science of burning calories. Your body burns calories all day not just during an active state. But YAZIO only tracks and displays the active calories burned. So if you walked 10 miles in a day, without your heart rate reaching an “active state” they WILL NOT COUNT IT. Which of course left me with a LOT of calories burned that weren’t counting on the app so after logging my meals for the day it would turn red and say I’ve eaten over my goal, when in fact I had been eating at too high of a deficit. This is dangerous to eat at too high of a deficit and therefore I find the tracking hazardous. You read that right. You will put your health at risk if you trust this apps calculations. I use a Garmin Venu which displays my active and inactive calories burned. Many other health trackers show this as well. Proceed with caution using this app. 

Best regards,
 a PRO user.
title: Still not adding up....

review: Love the functionality, tracking, and reporting, but the recent UI update requires more clicks than before to navigate into and out of meals to add items, and when you’re in a meal making additions you can’t see your daily totals. Given I often use the tool to plan my next meal ahead of time, not being able to see my daily overview while in a meal is a challenge. Also, the scrolling units entry feature is frustrating. If the default is 1 ounce, but I want to enter 7 grams, I scroll the number 1 to a 7, then the Ounces unit to Grams. When I change the units, the number scrolls back and resets at 1, forcing me to have to scroll the number back to 7 again. Hopefully they’ll address these issues and make the tool easier to navigate and make it easier to make entries.  Overall, still useful and robust.
title: Good, but recent UI update is a step back

developerResponse.body: Hi, Thank you for your feedback. We are constantly working on improving the database. We recommend using our verified items which can be identified by the blue checkmark and you can also add your own foods. That would be a great help to us in order to expand our database. Thanks! Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: New user here coming from MyFitnessPal, so far I like the app and like everyone, the interface is great! I love the integration with Apple watch so much I have added a complication to my watch face! The only complaint is that the data base needs work. I scan items and they are not found, but those same items are in MyFitnessPal. Also there are only 4 meals, I wish I could customize the meal number or like in MyFitnessPal it gives pre workout meal plus 5 meals. All in all I do like the app but the database needs a lot of work, I hate having to substitute a brand to get as close to the macros as I can when it's a name brand food. I am a pro member and bought the 12 month subscription also so..... Update, database still needs work! I scan things and they are not found. Sometimes I have time to enter and I will but others I don't and it gets frustrating.
title: Good not great

developerResponse.body:
Hi! In order to keep your diary as accurate as possible, it is advisable to weigh your groceries before consumption using a kitchen balance. Over time you will also get a better sense for the quantities. Of course it's allowed and possible to estimate the quantities.

Many products in our database already have a variety of different portion sizes such as glas, cup, teaspoon etc. Click on the default portion size to select a different one.

Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: Having used MyFitnessPal for years. I decided to switch to an app which worked better with Apple Health. After one day of frustrating food entry I wish I could get my money back. First of all it requires you to enter all food by the ounce/gram. This might be the most idiotic entry system ever. If I am on the run and stop at Chik-Fil-a for a chicken sandwich. I don’t have a scale on me to weigh it on. If I go to any major vendor or restaurant for nutritional info. It’s based on the item not the ounce. Why can I not enter food by item and a nutritional average. It say in the FAQ if I don’t make the item visible to others I can make serving size whatever I want. This wasn’t true. I unselected visible to others. Went to select and was only given weight options such as gram/ounce. How about sandwich or serving size large, medium or small. This food entry just isn’t for real people with day to day lives who can’t weigh every portion or cook every meal. It’s a real shame as I love the way it looks.
title: Horrible food entry

review:
Well that was extremely disappointing. I downloaded the app after seeing high review ratings, read the destruction in the App Store, and had seen some options for pro features to pay for 6 months or 12 months, etc.  But after I opened the all and began signing up, low and behold, there is NOTHING accessible in the “limited” app except a calorie tracker.  Really?!  Then please update your app description because this was very misleading.  No sooner did I enter my email, the app asked me to choose if I wanted the “Limited” option with calorie tracker only, or if I wanted to pay the $30 a year for the Pro Features (everything worthwhile...). So, no recipes, no meal plans, no statistics tracking, no fitness tracking, no mood tracking.  

TLDR;  don’t bother downloading if you don’t feel like paying the $30 right out the gate.
title: Bait and Switch - $30 a year for anything but a calorie tracker

review: I was very pleased to find this premium version of the YAZIO app at a great price! Only $20 a year! I found out after years on weight watchers and trying Noom $20 a month! Thankfully, that there’s this better and more affordable diet diary type app. I was particularly interested in fasting  support apps and being able to speak into the Apple Watch to track my meals on the go. It synchronizes exercise and calories perfectly. Really enjoying YAZIO at this point in time, I have been able to lose the 5lbs I gained through Thanksgiving and Christmas. I hope to be at my goal weight before my birthday in June.  I’ll update
title: Works great with my new Apple Watch

developerResponse.body:
Hi!
Have you selected "g, ml" as the standard unit in your app settings? You can do that here: Profile > Settings > Units.
If this doesn't help, please contact our customer support, thanks!
Your YAZIO team

review: I recently started using this app and so far I love it BUT! I don’t understand the point of the app asking for a unit when creating a food for the database, (such as ml, gram, etc) if it’s still not going to allow me to document my food by that unit. For example, I added a product to the database and wanted to document it in the diary by a ml measurement. Even though I selected ml as a standard unit it still gives me oz when it comes tine to journal how much of the product I ate. PLEASE give us more options for measuring the food please! I prefer to measure most things by gram since I believe it’s the most accurate. Or maybe I’m missing something? 🤷🏽‍♀️🥴
title: I love this for the most part........

review:
I find creating new foods to be difficult when entering portion sizes. Sometimes I get the correct portion size in there and sometimes it just shows 1 oz for the portion size with the nutritional value for a true portion, ie 3 oz. A lot of other people seem to have the same problem. Sometimes there are several entries for the same food with very different calorie counts.  And why isn’t the default weight grams, as that is the measurement on many packages of food. Why can’t I use grams and fluid oz. instead of grams and ml?
Also, I don’t think you can copy foods to different days without paying for the app. I get frustrated going in and searching for foods and then trying to figure out which is the correct one. 
The reason I use this app is to track my husband’s nutrition and calories. The one I use for myself is much more user friendly and flexible.
title: Free App is not the best

review: I love the app so much so I use it everyday compare to other nutrition app on my phone. The only problem I have is creating a meal is hard for me. So I tried putting in okra soup but the only option I had was Nigerian okra soup. Am African yes but not Nigerian so the way my country okra soup is made is very different from Nigerian Okra soup. There was an option to creating your meal by adding things in but is so difficult to manage I had to settle for the option of Nigerian Okra soup which gave me more calories than I had actually consumed. Besides this great app I would recommend it 100 times more than any nutrition app on my phone. Great Job Team YAZIO
title: Need a little more

review:
I’m only a couple days into using YAZIO— but that’s a couple days more than I’ve ever used any other fitness app. 

I really like how easy it is to track meals and the bar on top makes it very convenient to see when you are at your daily max for calories. I also really like that there are a couple integrative options for tracking your daily fitness efforts. Connecting the IPhone step counter was very easy and I like that the exercise is factored into the daily calories remaining bar. The recommended recipes feature is a nice addition as well, but most require a membership to access. (Many don’t look complicated however and I think just by looking at the photo you can kind of guess how to cook it for yourself.)

My only objection is that the app is advertised as an app for dietary/health management with a specialization in fasting. However, when you get the app, you will see that you must buy a membership in order to unlock the fasting options. 

Otherwise, the free functions are still very helpful and I have to see what happens! I’ll update if I manage to lose any weight :)
title: So Far So Good!

developerResponse.body:

We recently launched a website where you can enter your suggestions and also vote for existing ones, and there is already a feature suggested just like the one you requested. 
Do you mind voting for it here? https://feedback-en.yazio.com/suggestions/53474/net-carb-tracker
Regarding your other concern, we are constantly working on improving the database. We recommend using our verified items which can be identified by the blue checkmark and you can also add your own foods. That would be a great help to us in order to expand our database. Thanks again! 
Kind regards, 
Your YAZIO Team

review: I am on a keto diet and it doesn’t consider net carbs which is a big deal. Entering food into this app can be very annoying. The spinners will rest the row over if you don’t make sections in just the right order. The conversions for different measurements are often completely in accurate. For example 2 oz of something instead of a table spoon can result in wildly different numbers of calories and carbs. There are also a lot of bad and inaccurate items in the library so you are better off just entering all your own custom nutritional info. The default is for all entries to be public- I think it should be the other way around since they vary so much. I paid $30 for the app am going to keep looking for a better one.
title: Nice app but not quite what I am looking for

developerResponse.body:
Hi!
Of course you can contact us. :) You can find the contact form at "Help & FAQ" in the app or contact us directly at help@yazio.com.

There should be an "Add" button when entering your steps. Could you please send a screenshot to our support? Then we will look into it.

You can either maintain weight or lose weight, both is not possible. Of course you can maintain muscles when losing weight. The burned calories are added to your daily limit if you enter the activities in your diary. You can also enter activities manually, without connecting a third-party device.

Your YAZIO team

review:
First, there is no way to contact the developers. If you click on the app’s CONTACT link, you are shifted to an internet page display German addresses but NO EMAIL.

Second, there is no way to enter steps walked or miles bicycled. Yes, there is a place to type the number of steps walked, but there is no enter button or any other to actually get the data into the app for processing.  And nothing at all about bicycling.

Third, there is no plan for both losing weight and maintaining muscles.  Reducing calories may kill some fat, but it also really hits those muscles.  And strengthening muscles requires caloric intake which can also really built up the fat cells.  Any healthy regime must be built on an interactive regime of the right diet and the right exercise.  The developers of this app are apparently unaware of this, which makes the entire app suspect.

Fourth, the app expects the user to have an Apple Watch or a Fitbit or some other external device to monitor your walking and/or running.

The free app doesn’t seem to really offer anything much and the subscribed app doesn’t apparently offer much more beyond its own self-promotion. There may be more, but without a way to communicate with them, there is nothing I can see to warrant getting the app. 

In summary, the
title: What a Con!

developerResponse.body:
Hi, we are working on both issues you mentioned and will release an update for Watch and App in the next days! You can always contact us by using the request form on our help base: https://help.yazio.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: My main issue with this app is the fact that the Apple Watch app is broken. I'm all signed in and set up on my phone, but that won't sync to the Apple Watch. So when I open the app on Apple Watch, i'm only given the options to either log in (which is broken as well, nothing happens when you tap it), or you can sign up which I have already done. Also, the app restarts every time you leave it and go to another app. I don't know if it's a memory leak issue or what, but Yazio is being kicked from recent apps memory every time I close it on my 11 Pro Max. Lastly, I would have loved to message someone at the company about all this, but that's not something they offer. I was not able to find any contact info within the app, or under the help & faq section.
title: Many Issues with their apps

developerResponse.body:
Hi, Thanks for your feedback! 
Regarding your concerns: 
-The Horoscope feature: We are working on an option to maybe hide or remove this feature for those users who do not enjoy its content. This new option will be available by next week. 
-The meal reminders are found by going to Profile -> Settings -> Reminders and you can choose at which times you would like to receive the notification. 
-If you would like to edit the name of your meal categories, for example changing "Snacks" to something else, you can do so by going to: Profile -> Settings -> Diary -> Rename Meal Types. 
-In 2020 we will include more options for personalizing your diet and food preferences. 
We hope this information helps! 
Best regards, 
Your YAZIO Team

review:
I went ahead and paid for a year to try it out bc in case I loved it, that wasn’t a huge investment. I’m not upset I did - hopefully the developers will take my money and improve it to woo me back. 

It’s very pretty, but:

I don’t like the horoscope - screams of unhealthy diet mentality. 

Can’t schedule meal reminders. 
Can’t edit meal types (one “snacks” section?). 

Can’t record more than 2 food preferences (high protein, gluten free, sugar free, etc). 

I couldn’t seem to select a diet outside of what was suggested in my survey, but even if I could, they seem rigid without customization options. 

The baseline calories I was assigned to eat was much higher than every other app I’ve tried (by 500+ calories) and then even more so when I exercise. But also the kCal value of the food seemed higher, so maybe it’s consistently equivalent?

All that said, these are very specific complaints. The food selector seems easy to use and I love the mood “how I feel today” section. This app has a lot of promise and if you’re not looking for/concerned about the specifics I’ve mentioned, then try it out. It really is pretty and easy to use - which matters if you’re spending so much time with it.
title: Not what I’m looking for

developerResponse.body: Thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback! We're so happy that you enjoy using YAZIO and wish you all the best for your journey. If you have any problems or questions in the future, please contact our support team via request.yazio.com. Kind regards, Your YAZIO-Team

review:
Finally! An app that does not only do traditional tracking, but also incorporates intermittent fasting if you would like to have it all it one app. I love the color rich, inviting look of the app and how easy it is to use. 
I’m usually not a fan of subscription tracking apps, but Yazio is worth every penny. I have gritted my teeth and used MyFitnessPal for years (I even tried the premium), always hating the look and feel of the app. It was adequate. Yazio leaves MyFitnessPal in the dust.
This is the perfect app if you would like to move past entry-level tracking.
title: I Love This!

developerResponse.body:
Hi,
Thanks for your feedback! We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with the application. 
If the calories are not mainly from carbs, fat and protein, you might encounter issues in adding the product. This can especially happen with alcoholic products. We are sorry for the inconvenience!
We will work on a solution to make these products easier to add as well. In the meantime, you can also add it as a "custom entry". There will be no check of the nutritional values.
Kind regards, 
Your YAZIO Team

review: I’ve used this app for two days now. Testing it out to see if I wanted to upgrade to pro. I’m not exactly sure where it derives the recommended calories a day from but ok. I’ll roll with it. It is nice because it easily syncs with my Apple Watch through Health and knows how many calories I’ve burned from workouts and walking. But the counting calories feature is less than ideal. I drank a tea beer tonight and tried to add it. I put in the caloric information on the can, and it gave me an error message saying the fats, carbs and proteins didn’t add up to the caloric amount but I entered exactly what’s on the can! I don’t claim to be an expert in this stuff but it seems like you’re expected to be to use this app. I guess I’ll be trying a new app tomorrow. I’m glad I didn’t buy the pro version!
title: Can’t log food?

review:
Easy to use. I’ve been using it for about four days and I really love it. I am trying to lose 30 more pounds after having a baby, I’ve lost 50 so far just on my own  but I’ve stopped making progress. This gives me a clear idea of where I am at each day. I love that it calculates how much I’ve burned based on how many steps I’ve taken.
In app purchases bother me. It seems that’s the only app there is anymore but this app asks me to input information on new foods or recipes that I am restricted to seeing calculated in my daily total unless I pay a subscription fee. Seems unbalanced. But I will keep using the free version because I’ve enjoyed it so much
title: Great app but...

developerResponse.body:
Hi! To see your progess, simply head over to profile and "analysis" - there are plenty of charts that show you how you are doing over time :) 
We are constantly improving the data base. You can always recognize our verified entries by the green check mark. Also when you create your own foods, you can select from a greater variety of measurements! Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review:
I first saw an ad for this app on Instagram where it was comparing their food database to MFPs, they were saying theirs were better. That’s not true. Everything I’ve tried to input into this database to add to my food diary couldn’t be found whereas MFP had no troubles. 

The portion sizing is just weird. Ounces or grams are the only things you have available and sometimes it’s just wrong! I tried to put in an 8oz cup of hit chocolate into my food diary and it said it was over 900 calories! But if it kept it at the ounce it was correct. Completely inaccurate. 

I also don’t like how it tracks weight. I’m attempting to lose weight and having a visual chart the tracks your progress over the days, weeks, months, is pretty nice, but with this you only input your weight based on when you weigh yourself. It doesn’t track the progress or the ups and downs. 

The interface is nice and I like the design, but there are a few things that it needs to work on before I truly commit to this app. Also, they need to not try to tear another company down if they can’t back up their claims. It’s just tacky and disappointing
title: It’s ok

developerResponse.body: Since many entries in the database come from our users, unfortunately, some foods might have wrong information if a user made a mistake when entering them. We are working to correct these errors. You can recognize verified foods by the blue check mark or you can create your own foods with the right nutritional information. Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review:
I love YAZIO. The features are great, the premium service is affordable and insightful. The only downside I’ve come across that they lack compared to their competitors is the ability to instantly edit calorie and macro information for a product. Products have to change their info from time to time, and sometimes users completely miss some information. There is no way to correct this easily. Either enter in a new product entirely, or “report missing information” which as far as I can tell does little to nothing. 

If there was an easier way to fix outdated calorie information, I’d say this app is worthy of five stars.
title: Just one mod away from perfect

developerResponse.body: Hi, thank you for your feedback! You will not be forced to upgrade! However, there are quite a few advantages: https://help.yazio.com/hc/en-us/articles/208847005-What-are-the-advantages-of-PRO- Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: This is the only app I’ve used for weight loss.  I’m 58, never tried to lose a pound before, and it’s been instrumental as I’ve went from 190 pounds down to my college weight of 165.  It’s easy to set up a goal, enter meals, and see how many calories you’ve consumed. The program automatically found the Health app on my iPhone to track the calories I burn walking and exercising daily. In summary it is easier to use than I expected, performs more tasks than I expected, and the price is right (free). You can upgrade to a paid version but I see no reason to. If I’m ever forced to pay I’ll move on to a different app or do without.
title: Great assistant for losing weight

developerResponse.body:
Hi,

If you have any problems or questions in the future, please contact our support team via request.yazio.com.

review:
As a previous IF I wanted to return to it for general well-being and lose a few Kilos.
I came across this app by accident, even though I had already started 7 days prior, on my IF. This app has given me a variety of options to consider, control of my Calories and recipes to make to really make it fun!
I am not a youngster and believe in IF as it has been a great well-being method that has worked for me. This app, has made it all the more fun and encouraging to want to continue.
Thank you to all who created it!
title: Intermittent fasting made easy

developerResponse.body: We're already working on finding a solution to this problem as fast as possible. Please excuse the inconvenience! We hope to be able to provide you with a solution soon. Unfortunately, we cannot specify how long this will take exactly and therefore kindly ask you for your patience. Thank you very much for your understanding and your patience so far. Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: I’m giving this app a 4 star rating because it is a great app. However, the fasting tracker doesn’t track properly. I have my fasting time set to MWF, but it doesn’t keep the schedule correctly. It is saying that I can eat today when it’s supposed to be a fasting day. I am now going to have to manually set the fasting period and for the second time. Also when I look at my fasting history which only started this week, the days are off. It doesn’t show that I fasted on Monday, which I did.  Something needs to be fixed the fasting tracker.
title: Great app but a couple of complaints

review: I’ve been on YAZIO for 15 days and I’ve managed to stick to my new way of eating,16:8 No dinner, and I’m now down 8lbs. I love the reminders and the fact that it has everything I need in one app. Before I had two apps MFP and an IF timer  app.   The only thing they can work on is the food database (like MFP). You scan and all the info just pops up.  I see that people enter the info incorrectly or there are several choices under one option to choose from.  That my only issue with the app and why I didn’t give it 5 stars.  Other than that, I’m very very happy with it and do recommend it.
title: Finally something that helps me!

review: I have been using the Fitbit app for about 4 years and imho it is better for calorie and workout tracking. But Yazio is much better than the Apple health app for me. The Fitbit app has a much better food/calorie tracking interface and the food recognition of the Fitbit app is far superior in my experience. I just switched to Apple Watch a couple months ago and haven’t found an adequate app to sync the Apple Watch to the Fitbit app so YAZIO is doing a decent job of filling the gap. Besides the food recognition, I would like a little more control over the selection of my calorie deficit goals but all in all it’s not a bad app.
title: Almost but not there yet

developerResponse.body: Hi! We are constantly working on improving the database. We recommend using our verified items, which can be identified by the little check mark. Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: Nice interface but database is wonky. Lots of food missing, wrong calories listed multiple times and servings not listed as they are on the items label. When trying to add a new food to the database there is no option for “piece” or other common labels. Hard to weigh everything or do the math to figure out how many calories is in an ounce or gram of candy if it’s on the label as pieces. Using the app shouldn’t be that hard... Could be really good if the database of foods was larger and actually accurate. Till then I am going to have to stay with My Fitness, it seems to be the best & easiest to use. Sorry, I wanted it to be better☹️. I will keep checking back though.
title: Not ready for prime time yet...

developerResponse.body: Thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback! We're so happy that you enjoy using YAZIO and wish you all the best for your journey. If you have any problems or questions in the future, please contact our support team via request.yazio.com. Kind regards, Your YAZIO-Team

review: It’s a simple, easy to use app. It accommodates intermittent fasting. Counts calories without fuss. Easy to read. Available on iPad rather than a tiny phone with print too small to read. YAZIO has lots of food items w calories posted or you can log your own. No lectures. No gimmicks. No psychotherapy. No fuss with apps that wont synch. No false advertising. I left YAZIO for a psychology based diet app. But returned to YAZIO for a weight-loss app without hassles & frustration & expense & gimmicks to eek out more & more money from me. YAZIO works for me. Good luck to all on the weight-loss path!
title: YAZIO works!

review: I’ve used other weight loss apps before, expensive ... especially if you’re at goal and have a good grip on foods that keep you in you daily calorie range. My only complaint is the actual documentation of food... serving sizes don’t jive, should have more options, and many of the calories are wrong so I need to fumble with grams to get to the known calorie count. I’ve gained 5 lbs after loosing 115, I’m not going to let it creep up, this is great to get me back on the proper way to eat. Thank you for this free app !!
title: Nice calorie, nutrition counter for free

review:
I LOVE the layout of this app. Which I’m extremely picky about.. 
I cannot even say how many fasting/diet apps I’ve tried because 1 lacks what the other has. I’ve tried WW, Lose it, MyFitness, and a few other random apps but this one takes the cake. 

It’s kept short and simple, there’s recipes(idk about the amount but it’s a great variety so far), diary, NUTRITION (LOVE THIS), adds the activities from the health app to this app (so whatever Exercise app you have connected to Health, it’ll automatically fill out in YAZIO), add weight progress & photos if you’d like. Just.. all of the yes. I’m only using the free version right now but will definitely upgrade to the yearly soon. 

Even the free version gives you almost everything.. VERY few ads (as of right now anyway) and no access to recipes. But you can see the foods in the recipe book to see what’s there.
title: Everything in 1!!!!

developerResponse.body:
Hi,
Thank you so much for your great feedback. We really appreciate it!
We're so happy that you enjoy using YAZIO and wish you all the best for your journey.
If you have any problems or questions in the future, please contact our support team via request.yazio.com.

your YAZIO team

review: I love this app.💗  It’s a way for me to count my calories and stay on track.  If I want to have a heavy meal, I wait to do that on my exercise days .  The more you exercise, your body continue to burn calories during the day.   This app accounts for that.  Another added feature is that it have just about every food listed that you will need to keep track of those calories.  You can also scan any barcode to see if it’s available on the list.
title: Keeps me on track

review:
As bunch of other users already mentioned it doesn’t have a good food database. Even the common items that you’d think they should already have, it’s not available. I’ve used MyFitnessPal before and it has a great food database. 
The daily measurement log doesn’t seem to work properly. I’d enter the weight and I they measure ta and it’d reset to the default when I open the app next time. Even if it registers new measurements, it goes back to the default the next day! 
They should also include alternative ways of measuring portions. Right now it’s only Oz. What about cups, tsp, tbsp, grams, etc
I should also add that I like the motivational reminders :)
title: It needs improvement

developerResponse.body:
Hi, Thank you for your feedback. In 2020, we are working on greatly improving the database for you. In the meantime, we would suggest using our verified items, which can be identified by the blue checkmark, and also creating your own foods, as you're doing. That's a great help to us while we expand our database for the US. Thanks! Also, if the calories are not mainly from carbs, fat and protein, you might encounter issues in adding the product. This can especially happen with alcoholic products. We are sorry for the inconvenience! We are working on a solution to make adding these products easier as well. In the meantime, you can also add it as a "custom entry". There will be no check of the nutritional values. 
Regarding the reminders, you can switch them off at any time by going to Profile -> Settings -> Reminders and disabling the ones which bother you. We hope this information helps! 
Kind regards, 
Your YAZIO-Team

review:
I like that the app makes it easy to track water, fasting, macros, etc. However, the food library entries are almost always wrong and I have to enter pretty much everything manually. Even really basic stuff (one ounce of whiskey does not actually have 23 carbs in it, people. And one ounce of chicken isn't 709 calories!)

The reminders also get super annoying. I log my weight once a week and get daily reminders to "check in" with the scale. I bought the pro version and tried it for a few months but it's just more hassle than it is worth. Won't be using it in the future unless they do a major overhaul.
title: Some usefulness some frustration

review: So with the Covid and quarantine, my weight started inching upward.  While reading Covid info, obesity and diabetes are common factors for this virus.   I am only 70 and decided it was a perfect time to take control of my weight.  YAZIO is amazing and easy to use.  Simply track those calories, found in the app’s simple food directory.  And YAZIO is linked to your exercise/health app.  I’m doing this for free, but you can pay for other services on this app, like recipes and more.  I’ve lost 17 lbs. and my goal is 25.  Almost there.  I feel great!
title: Awesome way to lose weight!

developerResponse.body:
Hi, Thank you for your feedback. We are constantly working on improving the database. We recommend using our verified items which can be identified by the blue checkmark and you can also add your own foods. That would be a great help to us in order to expand our database. Thanks! 
Kind regards, 
Your YAZIO-Team

review: I purchased the pro version of this app because it looked really promising because of all of the different diets that it supports and the built in recipes and grocery list feature.  The problem is in the food database.  It is very incomplete.  I am having to look up all my food in another app’s database and then manually enter the calories into the YAZIO app.  Even when using the scan feature it brings up numerous items that you have to look through to find the correct one to log.  Basically it is double the work.  I wish I had just upgraded the app I have always used before.
title: Still Needs Some Work

developerResponse.body:
Hi,

review: I purchased this application at 11:51 AM. By 12:15 PM (The same day) I was asking for my money back. If you are a beginner and no nothing this is the perfect app for you. The pro version does nothing is advertised you cannot customize the settings as a relates to fast start and end dates, they are preset. I opened three support tickets with their support. The only ticket they respond to was my final support to get for a refund. And their response for my refund request was to be patient that is taking longer than usual for them to get back to anybody. Oh by the way, their refund policy is that the minute you start using the application you cannot get a refund! This developer is obviously not ready for prime time.
title: Do Not Buy

Hi,
Unfortunately, this issue can occur because some foods in the database might have wrong information if a user made a mistake when entering them. Sorry for the inconvenience! We are working on this and improving our database. You can always recognize our verified entries by the checkmark and it's also possible to create your own foods.
Kind regards,
Your YAZIO-Team

review: While the app has its merits the nutritional information database is COMPLETELY messed up.  Since anybody can add food to the global database you find multiple entries for the same food and most of them are completely incorrect.  (For example according to one of these a cup of Kellogg cornflakes has 43cal).  And it is not possible to simply exclude these from the app... or just let them know so they fix it nope you have to do the reporting and the fixing by adding the correct info.  There are LOTS of wrong entries for each food are we now working pro bono for the app?  The point of using this sort of application is to save time not waste it.
title: Database Completely Messed Up

developerResponse.body:
Hi, thank you so much for your feedback! It is much appreciated. In order to get an overview of feature request, we launched a separate page where you can add your ideas and also upvote ones from other users: https://yazioen.featureupvote.com/
Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review:
So! I just got this app today and really like the aesthetic lay out of it and how everything is structured. However, it is missing some key elements:

1) when adding in a food (bc the database is not that large) you should be able to add in measurements other than grams/ounces/ the “other” options they give you. The standard serving of a snack I was trying to add was 13 “clusters” but this app doesn’t allow you to make your own measurements

2) the fact that the amount of sugar in a food is something you have to PAY to see is ridiculous. I can’t think of another app that does this. Sugar should be included with all the other nutrients and ingredients, not behind a paywall. I don’t consider a single nutrient a premium feature you should have to pay for

3) for the fasting options, let us create our own custom app as well! 

That’s all the quibbles I have for now :) if these things get changed (primarily the first two) I can’t see why I’d ever go back to mfp
title: Good but some features missing

developerResponse.body: Since many entries in the database come from our users, unfortunately, some foods might have wrong information if a user made a mistake when entering them. We are working to correct these errors. You can recognize verified foods by the blue check mark or you can create your own foods. Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: Don’t get me wrong, I really like this app and I feel it’s worth the money to “keep me honest”. I love the layout (please don’t change it, it’s perfect!!) BUT you have to work on adding more things to the food list. In any of the many free food trackers I have used they have always had a fairly accurate and extensive food library for tracking.  I find this one not only lacking (no restaurant foods that I see) but also if there are multiple options the calorie counts are all over the map so which one do I pick???
title: Great, but

review: I keep getting the pop up to rate them and I guess the only way to make it stop is this. So here goes- this app has needlessly too many menu screens so simple things require hunting and tapping all over. There database has far too many duplicates and sometimes all of them are wrong. I’ve tried to correct some of the data on food items but the corrections never show up later. I’ve added food items using barcodes and later the barcodes don’t work. All of this make it hard to keep in the habit of tracking because it’s so difficult and often inaccurate.
title: Overly complicated and lacking detail

developerResponse.body: Hi, thank you for your feedback! We are currently putting a lot of effort into our database. You can always recognize our verified entries by the green checkmark. Soon it will also be possible to edit/flag wrong entries. Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review:
I really like how easy to use this app is, how comprehensive its calorie intake and burn recording is, how it pulls all sorts of data out of Apple Health, and how it’s got data for practically every food an exercise.

One flaw: this app relies on user-entered data for its food. There are all sorts of garbage food entries. (As an example, a cookie package says 280 calories but there are like three 1 calorie entries, a 130 calorie entry, and a 270 calorie entry.) There really needs to be a “flag for deletion” function for food entries. Also a “flag for cleanup” as a lot of entries are technically accurate but messily entered.
title: Great, with one flaw

developerResponse.body: Hi! If you can't find Hokkaido, we would suggest Butternut squash (although its a bit sweeter) and unlike the Hokkaido, it would be best to remove the skin because it takes longer to cook than the Hokkaido skin. We don't have instructions to remove the skin in our recipes since the Hokkaido skin softens a lot faster when cooking. Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: Confusing, too many words, app can be simplified in approach and layout design.  The meals are ridiculous with recipes that require ingredients 80% of the people won’t have in their refrigerator or spice rack.  Some recipes even require something called a hokkaido pumpkin.  Where the heck do you find that? Silliness.  If you really want to lose weight you don’t need an app to tell you what to do.  Do you really want to go to the grocery and buy things for these silly recipes for 1 serving everytime?  Who has time for that.  Bottomline, incorporate more than half of veggies into your meal, avoid sugar best you can.  Eat smaller portions, don’t over indulge unless its veggies only.  You will lose weight by following this simple plan.
title: Bad app design, bad plan

developerResponse.body:
Hi, 
Thank you for your feedback. 
Would you mind please getting in touch with our support team at: request.yazio.com, describing your issue in more detail, and sending screenshots? That way we can look into your problem further and try to help you find a solution. 
Kind regards, 
Your YAZIO-Team

review:
Tracks food well but the whole process is tedious. Most food items have the nutritional facts entered correctly so you either have to re-add it yourself or play around with metrics to get accurate tracking results.

Does not sync with Apple Health AT ALL anymore & has not been fixed in years. I’ve followed all the help suggestions, all of my buttons giving permission to share in both apps are turned on. Nothing works. From the moment I upgraded my 8 Plus to an 11 at the top of 2020, it stopped syncing with Apple Health. I now have a 13 Pro and nothing has improved in over 2 years
title: Doesn’t Sync with Apple Health

review: I love this app! It’s so amazing better then any of the apps I’ve ever used before. But it bothers me that I would have to pay money to get access to the fasting, to see more options of my weight. Yeah the couch option is understandable that u need to pay and The recipes. But for me to log in how my day was? I have to pay? For me to see my progress I need to pay??, it’s honestly irritating.. but that’s just my opinion I thought u would share with the creators of this app, which I mind u it’s a amazing app overall. I’m still gonna obviously use it but I just wish I could enjoy it more ❤️❤️❤️
title: It’s great but some side effects :(

review: What I really wanted was an app to help me know how many of which macros to eat to build muscle while losing weight. I lift and lift heavy. The only option for building muscle is for gaining or maintaining. I even spent the $ to go premium because it promised to unlock meal plans. The meal plans are complicated. I meal prep and used leftovers and the meal plans all have a completely different meal 3times a day. Nothing that feeds into another meal to save money or time. Also I eat many foods from Whole Foods and almost every time I’ve gone to log I need to create the food. It doesn’t recognize the barcodes. I just don’t log or try to find something close to save time. This isn’t the meal tracking app for my personal needs.
title: Not meeting expectations

review: I like this app because I can track what I eat throughout the day. It links to my Apple Watch so it detects my workouts and calories burned. It also links to my weigh in app so it updates my weight progress automatically. The only thing that I have to input daily is my food intake. I chose the goal to lose weight and it has given me the amount of calories I need a day and when my goal should be reached. I may, in the future, upgrade to Pro because it is not that expensive and you can access recipes and the “coach”.
title: Good app

developerResponse.body: Hi, thanks for your feedback! We are currently putting a lot of effort in correcting wrong food items. Soon it will also be possible to report wrong entries in the app. Best regards, your YAZIO-Team

review:
The food portion selections need to be more user friendly and based on how someone consumes them.  I do not measure by the ounce but do use tablespoon or teaspoon.  Fix that and it will be much better.

Also, for the price it should have much larger and robust food database.  People have to find comparable food items to substitute.  If this were free I’d give this feature more slack for not being available, but at this price point it should be there.

The UI is way busy.  It takes me a bit to understand what I’m seeing.  I do end up getting to the information I need but I would think others would like a much cleaner look and feel.
title: Needs work

review: I’m recovering from an eating disorder and this app has helped me feel more secure that I’m eating exactly what my body needs. Before I would survive off barely enough calories (mostly made up of carbs). By the end of the day I’d feel absolutely awful. Now I’m getting enough protein and fats and I’m the healthiest I’ve been in years! Thank you so much! I’ve recommended this app to all my friends.
title: Super helpful go pro!!!

developerResponse.body:
Hi,
Thank you for your feedback.
Unfortunately, if the calories are not mainly from carbs, fat, and protein, you might encounter issues in adding the product. This can especially happen with alcoholic products. We are sorry for the inconvenience and are working on a solution to make these products easier to add, as well.
In the meantime, as you have noticed, you can also add these products as a "custom entry". There will be no check of the nutritional values. Hope this helps! 
Kind regards,
Your YAZIO Team

review: I really do like this App but...I always get an error when trying to input new data. Example: I like Fit Vine wine but it has no fat and no protein but does have carbs and calories. This App will give you an error that says something to the effect of “calories do not match fat and protein”. Well, it won’t match. There aren’t any. Just sort of annoying to keep track of 90% of my day then have to add these off to the side. The total results for the week are not 100% logged on the App. Other than that, it’s not bad.
title: So far, it’s OK.

review: I’m a Registered Dietitian advising you to avoid this app.  The nutrition data is unreliable.  The micronutrient data is missing even after inputting a days worth of food (a painful process), the database is hopeless and the customer service is abysmal.  They hide the full nutrient data behind the pay wall for a reason.  It’s a deceptive business practice.  They then flat out refused my request for a refund.  I had to go to Apple who refunded me within minutes.  Yazio feel the money grab is worth driving away customers, a complete false economy showing their true values.   Just use MyFitnessPal, it gives you everything you need and more than Yazio, with the very best database, for free.
title: Just Another Diet Scam in App Form.

review: This looked like just the app I needed so I enthusiastically downloaded to give it a try. Since a few of the features I wanted were only available in PRO, I went ahead and purchased so I could get the full experience. Unfortunately, after about 3 weeks, I realized this app just wasn’t what I was hoping for, so I canceled, only to receive a message that my subscription would be available until renewal - NEXT YEAR - and that I can continue to access the PRO features until then. So, yay, I get access to an app that doesn’t have the features I need for a year...instead of a prorated refund. Terrible policy. Buyer beware.
title: DO NOT purchase PRO

review: This is the first app ive found that actually makes it easy and painless to count calories. The design is simple and attractive & the free features (like linking with my Apple health app to automatically subtract my calories burned from my daily total) are great. The only reason this isn’t a 5-star review is because the way to select & input food is somewhat disorganized. Still, it gets the job done better than any other free app ive tried. If you’re trying to keep track of what you eat/burn, I’d recommend it!
title: Great app!

developerResponse.body:
Hi,
Unfortunately, this issue can occur because some foods in the database might have wrong information if a user made a mistake when entering them. Sorry for the inconvenience! We are working on this. You can always recognize our verified entries by the checkmark and it's also possible to create your own foods.
Kind regards,
Your YAZIO-Team

review: I’m finding more and more that the nutrition information connected to barcodes I’ve scanned has been incorrect. Serving sizes are all over the place, entirely different products are coming up opposed to why was actually scanned etc. There needs to be some quality control in place for the added foods information for sure. Other than that the app has been solid, just finding the numbers aren’t accurate unless I manually create everything I’m adding, which is more than a little tedious.
title: Solid app, not without annoyances this

developerResponse.body:
Hi!

Due to a bug which we had in the iOS app, the barcode scanner didn't search for the correct barcode number. Therefore, no results were shown in this case. We've just fixed that with the version 4.8.4.

Sorry for the inconvenience!

We'd be glad if you try our app and the barcode scanner once again. :)

Best regards,
your YAZIO team

review: It takes a little while to get used to (~2 weeks), but awesome and super useful for having a better count of what you’re consuming. I’ve made progress towards my goal weight after two weeks, and feel good about it. Getting used to it can be frustrating, but totally worth it. Could use a larger and better organized dictionary of food to choose from.
title: Great but add more food

review: I’ve tried using this app for my tracking, even purchasing a pro subscription. The thing that frustrates me most is the serving sizes when I track. It’s either in oz or g, which is fine but that’s the ONLY options. It would be FANTASTIC to have an item, cup, tea/tablespoon servings added as options. I don’t have the ability to weigh everything. Even adding the food item it can be skewed. I’m on week 5 of trying to use the app but it is not great in that regard. At this moment, pro is a waste of my money if I can’t use the app.
title: I like it but needs improvements

review:
We are all familiar with the concept of police corruption, administrative corruption and political corruption. But there is also marketing corruption. Apple obviously allows this in the App Store, but it is not less corrupt for the allowance!

The corruption is simple: the app is “free”, but what the downloading dupe does not apprehend is that this is not a free app, but a come on; the downloader does not know that the app is an enticement to make purchases - no, not by following ads, which we’re all familiar with, but the purchase of what the app itself is putatively for.

I have decided to be generous and give two stars because this particular aspect may not at all reflect the coherence and workability of the weight loss and health uses of the (purchased?) program.

Maybe this app has such a high star rating mostly because people are accustomed to various corruptions and view the ilk as commonplace and ineluctable. But what a pitiable world that is!
title: Corruption (again!)

review: I am enjoy the app to track my Daily exercise and logging me foods. Only thing that I don’t like it the food log! It only holds a small amounts of the foods you eat so  everyday I have to re- enter foods I’ve eaten only a day or so before since I change up my foods daily. It’s time consuming and I don’t have the extra time to do this every day hence the 4 stars and since I pay for the app. It’s a silly no brainer thought even when entering in a meal it’s not as easy as it should be.
title: Great calorie tracker and exercise app

review: Love how the app picks up on my steps, movements and exercises. Great way to track calories and water intake. The view is user friendly, modern and enjoyable. The recipes page is frustrating. A lot of recipes are in “oz” and I have to constantly use a conversation chart on google to understand what X oz of something is in cups/tsp/etc. I also dislike how when I’m on the recipe page, if my phone screen locks/falls asleep, it boots me back to the main page and I lose my place on the recipe..
title: Good, Hoping for Improvements

developerResponse.body: Hi! We are constantly improving the database. We recommend using our verified entries which can be identified by the little checkmark! Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: I like this app because it tracks my burned calories through my Apple Watch. I like the recipes and suggested calorie intake for each meal. However, inputting calories is getting more frustrating because when I use the barcode scanner it is inaccurate most of the time. I end up manually adding the food and rescanning the barcode. When I search for the food by typing in the brand, a lot of times it results in “item not found” response. Please fix this because for $30 it is highly disappointing.
title: Somewhat Inaccurate

developerResponse.body:
Hi!

Due to a bug which we had in the iOS app, the barcode scanner didn't search for the correct barcode number. Therefore, no results were shown in this case. We've just fixed that with the version 4.8.4.

Sorry for the inconvenience!

We'd be glad if you try our app and the barcode scanner once again. :)

Best regards,
your YAZIO team

review: I’m enjoying this app because it makes me accountable and helps with food tracking. However, the nutrition data seems off. Homemade scrambled eggs shows up as a processed food; yogurt is high in salt? And the default portion size seems to be 1oz, which doesn’t relate to many foods. I’ve yet to scan a barcode and find the food already in the database, so there is a lot of laborious manual entry. I eat a diverse range of food so that could continue for some time. Still, if I ignore the data details I still find that using the app is a great discipline.
title: Nutrition data is funky

developerResponse.body:
Hi!

Please note:
Due to a bug which we had in the iOS app, the barcode scanner didn't search for the correct barcode number. Therefore, no results were shown in this case. We've just fixed that with the version 4.8.4.

Sorry for the inconvenience!

We'd be glad if you try our app and the barcode scanner once again. :)

Best regards,
your YAZIO team

review: This app did a great job of integrating with my Apple Watch. However, doing the food log for meals was a bit more labor intensive than other similar apps I’ve used. Most brands appeared to be those in the UK, not the US. This is fine, except I am not using those brands. I manually entered in several items but when I went to add them to my log, the calories were different than those I just entered. It also turned everything in to 1oz portions. I’ll find one that works better for easy food tracking.
title: User friendly and good looking, made for UK?

review:
The nutritional database for this app doesn’t have accurate per-serving info. And by that I mean *real* serving sizes. Who eats 8 oz. of a 19 oz. can of soup? Who eats 1 oz. of a breakfast patty where a single patty is more than an ounce and the label lists the serving size in grams?

If I’m required to do unit conversions, I’m not gonna stick to a diet. 

Developer: please don’t respond with a disingenuous excuse (or at all). Fix the problem, or don’t — I’m sure you have your reasons and they make a lot of sense to you. But this issue makes the app very difficult to use, so... delete! Try another. There is certainly no shortage!
title: Nutritional info difficult to use

review:
I really do love this app, it helps me keep track of what I’m consuming. It really opened my eyes to the overeating and the unhealthy eating in my life. I have been able to take charge and change what needs to be changed.

The only downside is when I try to add thoughts or feelings throughout the day some I have to repeatedly put, it won’t keep what I’ve selected up.
title: Love this app!

review:
Love this app and wish I could give it 5 stars. Everything’s great and the amount of extra data you can track like body measurements is awesome .

Fasting part is what makes 4star. A big thing a lot of people seem to want is so simple, just add a manual tracking option to the fasting. I’ll click the button when I start and when I stop. Seems so simple. Will raise rating if the update ever happens.
title: Almost the best

review: After a traumatic injury I suffered a year ago, I started using this app, knowing how important my nutrition would be for my recovery and for my future. A year later Im recovered and healthier than ever before! All thanks do to this app! It makes calorie counting fun and easy, the recipes are healthy and delicious, and the ability to pair with my Fitbit works perfectly! Thank you YAZIO team, you guys are the best!
title: Changed my life!

developerResponse.body:
Hi,
Thank you for your feedback.
Would you mind please getting in touch with our support team at: request.yazio.com, describing your issue in more detail, and sending screenshots? That way we can look into your problem further and try to help you find a solution.
Kind regards,
Your YAZIO-Team

review: Love the recipes and different fasting options. Few bugs though, 1) widget doesn’t correctly reflect fasting periods and way too big (smaller size please), 2) Apple Watch complication doesn’t correctly display fasting status, and 3) please make auto fasting an option but not a default, it would be great to not have to adjust the start and end time every time, I’d like to have a button that starts the fasting when I’m ready.
title: App with great potential but room for improvement

developerResponse.body:
Hi!
Apple Health recently added a feature which also takes your food into account when calculating your water intake. That's why the total amount differs in Health and YAZIO. Please take a look at the details of your water intake in Apple Health.
If you opened the app with internet once, you should then be able to use it without internet as well. We will make the app fully usable without internet access in the future!
Your YAZIO team

review:
Been using Yazio for about 3 weeks. Was almost ready to buy a subscription when I was suddenly surprised to find it refuses to load at all without Internet access, regardless of not being logged in to the company’s proprietary cloud account or trying to look up any new information.

The app also has issues with standard/metric conversion, consistently registering 27 fl. oz. of water as ~1000mL in the Apple Health app, when the correct conversion would be 800mL. Presumably other figures are similarly inaccurate.

Great idea here, but the devil’s in the details, and the details of Yazio fall flat.
title: Great idea, terrible implementation

review: I love this app! (Btw I didn’t get the pro) I have always had trouble drinking water. I would go days without drinking anything. But with the water tracker, it made me drink 64 fl oz a day! I also love that I can track my calorie, fat, carb, and protein intake. If you are trying to keep track of calories,  carbs etc, I definitely recommend this app. And the best part is that everything that I’ve said IS FREE!
title: Great App!

review: I like the app look and organization and it has been working great for me.  I like the option to build a meal so you don't have to select individual items each time.  But I really hate how it doesn't allow you to set a serving size for it to default to that makes sense.  Also need to have an option to measure in cups, Tablespoons, etc.  That's why I took a star off.
title: Good but adding food is not great.

review: I’m pleased to say that now that the app. has been around for some time, all the bugs are worked out and it works very well. A little slow to update across my iPhone and Apple Watch, but it does eventually. I like setting up favorite foods and then I can track my calories. It has made me better at portion control too as the app. requires that you kinda know the approx. weight (oz.) of foods.
title: Good food/cal. tracker

developerResponse.body:
Hi Sophie,
The basic version of YAZIO is completely free. Only if you would like to use the PRO features, you need to purchase an upgrade.
To understand the benefits of our PRO subscription, please refer to the information in this article: 
https://help.yazio.com/hc/articles/208847005
Kind regards, 
Your YAZIO-Team

review: It doesn’t say anywhere that you have to pay $ to use the app before you download it. I have not been able to find any useable free content since downloading. Everything points me to a pro membership in order to do anything on this app. If there is free content, it is not obvious and very difficult to find. You need to make it clear that this is not a free app before people download it. There is no obvious free content whether there actually is or not. Update: I have not found anything useable for free. What do you get to use for free and how do you access the free content?
title: Not free

review:
I have never reviewed any app of any kind but I felt compelled to do so today, this app if you are doing intermittent fasting and tracking your calories is the best I’ve ever come across, it’s very very helpful and worth every penny, to be honest they should charge $99 per year but they charge a one time fee, sign up ASAP if you’re serious about getting healthy.

John M
title: Best fitness app ever
