review: I just read good reviews about this app and tried my hands on and paid for full one year subscription, can not add new food gives error ‘VERIFY INFORMATION - the selected serving size does not match the nutrition facts you’ve entered’. I am entering exactly the same info as provided on pack of good products. Neither dose it identifies bar codes. I am disappointed. FIX THIS ISSUE
title: Can’t add new food

review:
It’s a useful app and love all the features. However, there are a few things that could be improved. 
For example I would like to have the possibility to search the recipes that I make by typing on the search bar instead pf scrolling up and down.
Also, if I misspell a word, the app should suggest me the right word. 
Lastly, I would like to be able to see the percentage of the macronutrients I eat for each meal, not just the total amount.
title: Useful app

review: This app has great features and would be even better if it would go back to recipe I’m working on when my phone locks after non-use for over 1 minute. If I walk away from my phone and have to log back in, I have to open the app and find the recipe each and every time. It’s frustrating and makes it a challenge while you’re trying to follow a recipe directly from the app. Also, it would have been great to test this app out for more than a few hours before I’m charged for the whole year. Please fix this problem.
title: Great app except...

review:
I love using this app. I love the food entries and how you can share then publicly and not have to worry about entering a new food since others have already entered them. Thanks guys! The app also tracks not just calories but also other important nutritional, such as sugar. 

Question for the devs, is there a way to sync the sugar to the health app? 

It would be a much help especially for us diabetics who uses health app ^_^
title: Great app

review: I’m not going to rely on the calorie/fat/carbs/sugar totals put in by other users. I went to enter my Dutch Bros coffee this morning (had a large carmelizer, yumm!) and when I put in how many ounces it was and came up with over 2,000 calories!!! Ok I looked it up online, a 20oz is 510 calories. I recognize that many of these are created by other users but come on! That made me freak out at first!
title: I like it but...

developerResponse.body: Hi, please make sure, that the nutrients are also listed for each food item. If they are not, they will not appear in the diary either. We recommend using our verified foods (the ones with the check mark) in order to get the best data. Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: I would give this review five stars, however after very carefully and dutifully tracking my diet I noticed that many nutrients aren’t accounted for, an example, sweet potatoes carrots and broccoli all have quite a bit of vitamin a. I consumed a ton one day and my log shows none for the day. I’m majoring in nutrition so tracking my nutrients is a big part of my day. The vitamin a is just one example, though many of the nutrients are deficient in logging.
title: Nutrients don’t show up

developerResponse.body: Hi, thank you for your feedback! We are already working on the watch issue with high priority. Sorry for any inconvenience! Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: I like this app and concept, but I chose it for watch compatibility. It only worked on my watch the first time I used the app, and now it just says “loading” on every screen. Still works on my phone though, so I’ll keep tracking and hold tight until it gets fixed (hopefully). Also, in the brief time I used the watch app, I discovered when you log food you can’t see the producer, which greatly affects which item you choose. The producer should be able to be shown via watch too please.
title: Great on phone, glitchy on watch

review: The app makes you enter carbs, fat, and protein content for a new item and makes sure that the amounts you enter for these nutrients jive with the total calories you enter. However, alcohol has calories and there is no input field for alcohol as a nutrient. The app is programmed to not accept the entry of there is a mismatch and does not allow entry of cal from Alcohol. You get a message that says “the total calories does not match the nutrients”. Calories from alcohol should be a factor in the math check that the app is doing.
title: Does not accurately record alcohol

developerResponse.body: Hi, Thank you for your feedback. Unfortunately, as you have noticed, YAZIO cannot calculate or count net carbs yet. However, we do have Keto recipes in the app and a Keto meal plan if that helps you with your Keto diet :) In regards to your suggestion, it might be a useful feature for the future since we know other users that follow Keto encounter the same problem as you. We recently launched a website where you can enter your suggestions and also vote for existing ones, and there is already a feature suggested just like the one you requested. Do you mind voting for it here? https://feedback-en.yazio.com/suggestions/53474/net-carb-tracker Regarding your other concern, we are constantly working on improving the database. We recommend using our verified items which can be identified by the blue checkmark and you can also create your own foods. That would be a great help to us in order to expand our database. Thanks again! Kind regards, Your YAZIO Team

review:
YAZIO, you’ve got to clean up your food database, too much misinformation. It’s nice to see the green indicator that nutritional data has been verified, but the ratio of inaccuracy is enough to make me not want to bother. 
Also, as a Keto coach, I’m always searching for a good tracker app. I love the interface, ease of use, reminders, Apple Watch capabilities, recipes and coaching options. Please add an option for net carbs!!! This is essential. I’d really like to start recommending this app, but it’s not ready for the keto community.
title: Has potential but needs work

developerResponse.body:
Hi!

The edit feature for meals is already on our list for the upcoming development. :)
The recipes should definitely not disappear. Could you send an email to help@yazio.com and describe the issue in more detail? Screenshots would also be very helpful. Thanks!

Your YAZIO team

review:
This app is not user friendly enough to charge what they are charging for the “PRO” service.  Meals cannot be edited and recipes disappear.  

A ton of little things need to be improved to justify the price tag.  For example, I am tracking protein and fiber.  The app doesn’t give me an option of customizing what I want to track on my watch as goal

I rated this as 3 stars because I haven’t given up yet but I am not sure how many more custom meal/recipe attempts I will try before deleting the app.
title: Could be so good

review: I hope to come back to redo my review... only been using for a few days... One thing I'd really like to ask the developers for is a "home" button at the bottom of the screen instead of having to hit dinner, back, cancel... after adding a food. We will see if I buy the subscription...
title: So far so good...

review: I love everything about this app and how it allows you to track almost anything. But I feel like it would be even better if it gave an option that allowed you to see workout videos and track them. It also would be cool to make your own workout videos and allow other users to see it.
title: Great but 1 suggestion

developerResponse.body: Thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback! We're so happy that you enjoy using YAZIO and wish you all the best for your journey. If you have any problems or questions in the future, please contact our support team via request.yazio.com. Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review: This is an excellent app and when you get it for 75% off yearly at around $22 plus tax comes to about two dollars a day it does everything excellent intermittent fasting for not just dieting but a lifestyle change to be healthier and lose weight I would personally recommend this to anybody that doesn’t want to diet but want long term health and weight loss!
title: YAZIO App.

review:
I have just begun tracking what I eat daily certainly a great way for me to be aware of what I am eating daily .
I am finding the recording easy to record with the wealth of products already in the data base. I am becoming aware of quantities and still enjoying the foods I enjoy along with staying in the desired calorie goal. I do appreciate the reminders .
title: Just beginning... shooting for success

review:
It’s not super customizable.. I work overnights, so I sleep days.. but the fasting calendars really only work for typical sleep/wake schedules..

I’d like to be able to create my meal plan for meal prep.. not just eat what it says.. I have some things I can’t have like dairy (which they do let you take off), but also a lot of meats.. and I don’t want to spend a fortune on the plans that it does give me..

Idk.. I was really hopeful.. but I now use so many different apps for this stuff that this one kinda gets pushed aside..
title: It’s nice but

review: I have been using this app for about half year now and it working perfectly! However, recently it get updated and after that yazio widget is not showing up correctly. I don’t know its just my phone problem... so if its app problem, i hopefully get fix it soon! Thank u!
title: iphone widget not working

review: This app really works! You use together with a food scale for more accurate counting results. Input English data will be more accurate than other languages i guess. I still have to check on USDA database because sometimes data on the app is not correct. But overall, it works!!!!
title: Highly recommend!!!

review:
After trying literally EVERY OTHER nutrition/dieting app theres one clear conclusion - yazio outdoes them in all categories. Design, intuitiveness, content and price!!! You get the best  and nicest features at an extremely reasonable cost. Never going back!!
The only tip I have for the developers is to show more of the actual app interface in the app store. That will definitely attract more people.

developerResponse.body:
Hi!

You can create a meal as follows:
1. Enter all foods you want to combine as a meal into your diary
2. Click on the edit icon  in the upper left corner of the diary screen
3. Select all the foods you want to combine as a meal
4. Click on the meal icon  in the bottom menu bar
5. Enter a name for the meal and confirm it
The created meal will now be displayed in the list of your created meals.

Tip: If you want to combine all foods of a specific time of day (e.g. breakfast) as a meal, you can also click on the three dots in the lower right-hand corner of the respective time of day and select "Create meal". Then enter a name for the meal and confirm it.

In regards to the portions: In many foods we already have a variety of servings available. We're constantly expanding our database. :)

Best regards,
your YAZIO team

review: I switched from Weight Watchers to this app. Their App is similar, but much better with portion identification. So far, there are only two things I have questions about. How can I create a meal for something I eat every day? It’s a pain to have to recreate it each day. Also, like I said above, portion ID. I would love to see additional portions, like slices; per cookie; tsp; Tbs; pieces, that sort of thing. We need more options. I do love the app and the help that it is.
title: Great, but.....

review: This app is awesome, but I just have one problem. My request isn’t necessary, but there should be a year set for least 2010 and under since the app age requirements are 4+. For myself, I am a middle schooler and I’m trying to lose weight, so please try and make some updates. Thank you ❤️

review: … appreciate VeSync as an alternative because it also offers inexpensive hardware like a smart scale that calculates your carbs, fat and protein right on the screen. So you have instant control of that 20-30g intake. Not to mention it’s tracking feature that matches YAZIO if not better. If that is not enough. It’s free — No subscription. And syncs with Apple Health.
title: Love Yzio? You then will …

review:
I use to use my fitness pal and I saw this in an ad the only thing it lacks is the barcodes when I scan barcodes most items are not found. On the ad they said it’s more accurate with barcodes than my fitness pal so far I haven’t seen it. 
Update: I have been using this app for a few weeks with the membership it still doesn’t have as much food options like myfitnesspal. I don’t understand why they bragged about being better when there is so much less options. When my membership is up I’m switching back to myfitnesspal
title: Not to bad so far

review:
I like this one because you can customize/count macros. As long as you make sure to measure the food in real life this app will work for you. I 

I don’t like the meal plan or recipe sections though. They are not customizable enough. They seem like they care more about sounding good and getting a pretty photo than actually helping you decide what to eat. Definitely not marketed towards the everyday real person.

review: The idea and layout is great. However, the user interface is sometimes difficult to navigate and the support is terrible. I have emailed them three times in the last week with issues, I just started with this app last week, and I have yet to get a response. I would like to fix my issues with it because it does have things about it that I prefer to other similar apps but I’m seriously considering deleting my account and contacting Apple for a refund.
title: Could use work

review: This app is awesome. It still needs some work as far as the database and more importantly the graphics associated with the the items. More serving sizes should be available as well. I am a graphic and web designer. I also create content for web. I’d be happy to take the database to next level by entering tons of data and associating appropriate images with each one making this awesome app THAT MUCH BETTER!!
title: Almost there

review: This app has everything I’ve been looking for however it is really difficult to get around and to set up new foods and things like that for some reason. I’m sure it’s operator problems but it’s new so hopefully I can get this under wraps but thank you so much it’s so important to me and I love the fasting!

review: It’s not perfect, the food database could be better and be more flexible (lots of stuff measured in ounces when it would be easier to select pieces for example). It gets the job done and isn’t as intrusive as other similar apps that want to sell me a cook book or sign up for other services. Thanks for helping me lose weight YAZIO!
title: Gets the job done

review: Pretty much a completely useless app unless you pay for the subscription. There are other free apps that allow you to more without getting the subscription. Can't set up the intermittent fasting without paying. Can't use a fitness tracker without paying. Deleted my account after less than 5 minutes trying it out. I'll bet you have to pay to use the scanner to scan food. Why even offer this as a free app of you're just going to make people pay to get even basic functionality. What a despicable company.

review: My only issues with the app is that it has a week search database and if I add a food and barcode it says it’s taking my measurements and serving... but when it’s all said and done it’ll only register the ounce unit and defaults back to 1oz. If you fix those two things, add way more popular Whole Foods brands, then I’d gladly give 5 Stars. One of your competitors has a huge database. But I came to you hoping for something better... don’t disappoint 🙏
title: Good could be better

review:
Database needs to have a lot more foods to enter by scanning than it currently does. Scanner rarely works for foods I enter, meaning that I must enter manually on the majority of my foods. 
Also there are very limited choices in serving size, usually just ounces. I would like to see cups, tablespoons, slice, piece, and all of the other options, making it far simpler to calculate calories. Bringing these two issues into the picture would make a good calorie counter an excellent one.

review: I love the app. I just started the keto diet and I track all my meals/water intake. My only issue is there seems to be a major discrepancy with the way sodium intake is logged. Some days it’s normal and some days it’s showing a sodium intake in the hundred thousands of mg. I’ve gone back to look at the foods I was eating and check the nutrition labels and it doesn’t add. Please look into this!

developerResponse.body:

review: I like to be able to track my calories and what I eat but I would like to be able to print it because I am taking a nutrition class and I chart and turn it on weekly. Right now I have to make two entries because I can’t print this program.
title: Using App

review:
This App does it all!! It is absolutely worth the annual subscription price. 
You can choose your Fasting goals, log water, do challenges, keep track of all body measurements. It interfaces with the Health App on iPhone!! There are recipes, you can log in your own recipes!! This app can do no wrong!!
title: Yes!! The perfect Fasting App!!

review: I use the free version which is super handy. It has a lot of different foods in its database. But I’m wondering how accurate the calories are. Everything defaults to 3.53 ounces for some reason. One item I put in (Hannaford Tortilla chips) said 1 cup was over 2500 calories... which according to the label is inaccurate. Happens a lot actually. Serving size doesn’t match up to nutrition label on food. I’m trying not to cheat and a 100 calorie difference in a day can make or break it.
title: Yes and no...

review:
I have been using MyFitnessPal for a long time. I have also been stuck at the same weight for a long time. I thought the change of program might help me get going again. 

The food logging with this app is TERRIBLE! Everything is in ounces, even when I create my own recipe. So, I have no idea how much to put in. I created a recipe for a healthy homemade pizza I found online. When I went to enter it, even though I tried to say it had 6 slices, I had to enter it in ounces. 

The only way I can get the food right is to log it all In MyFitnessPal and then transfer the number into this app calling it a “custom entry”. 

I may just kiss my money goodbye and go back to MFP. I was really looking forward to the change, especially since I could use my Apple Watch with this app, but it takes my twice as long to enter my food.
title: I regret paying for the premium plan!

review:
App is really well constructed and easy to a use. I am not a big fan of the way they do food measurement. I want to be able to log that I am having one serving of an item and a lot of times it won’t have the serving size, just random weight measurements. 

Ex: I’m having on serving of brand of cereal which equals 130 Cals. They have exact name and brand of cereal but only have measurement in ounces size not serving.
title: Odd measurement

review: I got the PRO version, did what the app said, and lost 10lbs in 6 weeks. That’s a nice and quick improvement for anyone who is overweight. All you do is log your meals and activity in the app. It makes you form good habits, and you naturally learn what you did wrong before. It’s also a nice looking app.
title: Get it- it actually works.

Not sure what happened to this app but at least in the current version the basic functionality doesn’t work. I got this app to help monitor what I eat. Yet this app gives me no guidance for the amount of calories to eat per meal. Which was the whole point of it. 

Also at least one of the widgets is completely broken and gives you the wrong data. I am hoping apple refunds my money so I can’t find another app that works.

review: I bought the app on the Black Friday sale. It was working great and I was actually enjoying tracking and seeing my progress. Then tonight, it’s suddenly throwing an error. It won’t open, it won’t recognize my login info. It won’t even let me reset my password. I have deleted it four times and restarted my phone. Still not working?!?!!! And the website isn’t offering any help in the “help” section. I would like someone to reach out to me or I would like a refund.
title: App Not Working

review: Tried this app out because I was looking for something different after using MyFitnessPal for years. I absolutely love how aesthetically pleasing to the eye this app is. However, the food database needs a TON of work. My first day using it, the first 4 things I scanned had completely wrong nutrition info. The units also set up for many of the different foods are totally weird too. I think that if that database gets some work, that this is an app that I would use.
title: This app could be amazing

review:
MY FITNESS PAL has been my food tracking app for several years now. Their database is fantastic and is growing all the time. 4 times out of 6 YAZIO has failed to pull correct data or any data sometimes. 
As an example if you have a frozen burrito and it’s serving size is the entire burrito it should pull up that way not in ounces. Then when you put the ounces in the calories don’t match the package. I’m back to MY FITNESS PAL for now. I do like the presentation on the screen.
title: YAZIO has a long way to go

review:
As a Pro-User, Yazio in general works great, but there are a couple of things that make it inferior to other calorie-tracker apps:

- Meal Plans and Meal Suggestions: there is no way you can set the ingredient list permanently (or at all) to one serving. I either cook for one or three people, having to recalculate the e.g. 6-serving meal suggestions is annoying. You always have to pay attention to the serving sizes, since it varies from 1-6, which just bothers me in an app I pay for. 

- I would prefer more additonal measurements , for example ‚tablespoon‘ instead of just grams. 

Other than that, I enjoy the app and it helps me keep on track with my goals.
title: Few suggestions to make it a 5 Star App

review:
The description made it sound like YAZIO is Keto friendly, but there’s more needed to get it there. I like the app but need a few adjustments for it to really be effective:

(Keto) please add a place to add sugar alcohols
(Keto) add functionality/option to track net carbs (total carbs - fiber - sugar alcohols) instead of carbs
(General) defect when adding new food. I added Rebel Cookies & Cream Ice Cream and filled in 69 g serving size. After it saved, the numbers were calculated wrong 
(General) when a serving is defined, allow users to log number of servings as an option in addition to specifying volume. 
(General) Provide a method to correct a food entered or submit a correction to be reviewed

If love to be a beta tester if needed!!!
title: Not as keto friendly as it seems + a few improvements needed

review: It looked like a great app and stupidly bought the subscription. I wasted an hour trying to enter today’s meals. They don’t let you change standard 1oz serving so if you try to add a food that’s in the list that’s more than one ounce then it multiplies the calories by the number of ounces. Help is no help. They won’t refund my subscription even though I only subscribed 30 minutes ago. Ripped off again. I should know better when something looks too good to be true.
title: Don’t use and DON’t SUBSCRIBE!  Not intuitive and hard to use.

developerResponse.body:

review: The app is great I terms of recipes and clear ingredients and instructions. My main gripe with this app is that you cannot edit recipes if you can’t eat something in it or don’t like something. I know you can manually create recipes but it would be great if you could easily edit ones that are already in there! Also maybe have the ability to use tablespoon and teaspoon instead of oz!

review: I’m a bit frustrated with this purchase. It has a very low food database for my area. I spend far too many hours trying to enter food manually. That’s not what I purchased this app for!  It has a nice interface and is otherwise easy to use. But if I can’t enter a meal within a couple minutes, I lose interest in this app and wish I had stayed with my previous app. Not impressed YAZIO. Sorry

review: I’ve been using this app for four days. So far I lost 5 lbs. I have been drinking a lot of water doing the low carb high protein diet and exercise. I’m sure a lot of the reason is because of my bad habits before. But definitely feeling better.

userName: trying to get my life back

developerResponse.body: Hi, you can change the units within your settings! All information on units and measurements can be found here: https://help.yazio.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000539077-How-can-I-change-portion-sizes-and-units-of-measurement- Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review:
I really wanted to like this app, as I’m sick of MFP. But every thing is set to a one oz serving size and there is no way to set it to grams, servings or anything but OZ. Entering food is an incredible pain and things often don’t come up right or the nutrition listed is just wrong. 
Glad I didn’t pay for “Pro”

Can’t wait for the same response to be posted on this review saying how “They’re working diligently” on something as simple as not listing everything as oz

**edit to add, no you cannot change the serving size from oz, as that’s what is programmed into the food entry system regardless of what the actual serving size is. I even created a few recipes and they all list oz as the only selection for serving size despite me carefully entering the correct info.
title: Every serving size is set to OZ

Wish I had never bought the pro upgrade! Stupid app!

It’s also non refundable so that should tell you that there is obviously no guarantee for a successful fitness journey.

The previous version was more useful.

Cons:

review:
After using this for a month and a half, and having used other apps these are my thoughts on YAZIO. 

What I like:
Easy to navigate to record foods

What I dislike:
Missing a lot of foods
No section for restaurant foods
I really hate how everything defaults to 1 oz for measurement. I cannot estimate ounces if I’m cooking or at a restaurant. Tell me what the standard serving size is. Even if I scan a food, it won’t document what the packaging says the calories are, only the calories per ounce.

I will most likely be switching to a different app.

developerResponse.body:
Hi! 
In order to keep track of your YAZIO diary on your Apple Watch, you can use the YAZIO app on your watch. Once you have installed YAZIO on your iPhone, open the Watch app, scroll down to "YAZIO" and enable it for your Apple Watch.
Furthermore, you can also enable the sync between Apple Health and YAZIO. This will import your Apple Watch activities into our app. To enable it, go to Profile -> Automatic Tracking -> Apple Health and click on "Connect". 
Kind regards, your YAZIO-Team

review:
UPDATE: thanks for responding to the review! I updated from 1 star to more accurately rate the app plus another star in appreciation for your response. I’ll be sure to check out the app again in a few months. I wish you well 😁

OLD REVIEW: Just let me try the app without all the questions and making an account

I just downloaded a bunch of tracking apps because I’m trying to find something that will easily let me visually see photos of what I ate. Bonus that this one seemed to do that, in addition seems to track calories, so it could also replace MFP for me.

I just wanted to try the app, but first, I had to answer a bunch of personal questions 😑 Then, I make it through all the questions, THEN I find out I have to start an account and give you my email address. Mind you, I still haven’t even been able to try the app to see if I want to use it. I was about to delete it, and came back here to leave a one star rating for making me go through all the questions and then springing the account thing on me, when I saw the app looked really good, so I decided to try it. 

I entered my spam email address, and finally, I was in. I got through the pop ups, and started to enter my breakfast. First food: eggs. Searched that, and it has a photo of...a chicken leg 🤦‍♀️ 

Ok, well, whatever, I mainly came for a photo diary, which it looks like you can do based on the photos. However, I couldn’t figure out how to do it. Admittedly, I didn’t try that hard, but it wasn’t intuitive. 

The pros of this app is it has a much more attractive UI than MFP, but less in the database. If there is actually a way to add photos, that would be a pro. It would be better suited to those who don’t know how to lose weight/what to eat, because the app seems to tell you that. I know what to eat, I just need a way to track foods and see photos in a visually pleasing way. This app isn’t for me, but not every thing is for everyone, and that’s ok.

The app itself might be about 3-4 stars, but this is a protest review against not just letting me try the app without tricking me into going through all those questions before making an account. If I had just been able to try the app, I would not have left a review unless it was going to be 5 stars. Please be considerate of people’s time while they are trying to search for an app and let them quickly try it. Thanks for considering it and taking the time to read this. It does look like this app looks promising (for what it’s intended to do). I wish you well :)
title: Thanks for responding to the review 😁

review: There are things to like about this app. I like the clean look, the automatic calorie count for the amount of weight to lose, the customer service is responsive to my emails, and the intermittent fasting timer is something I would use. I paid for the yearly pro version. There are deal breakers for me. The first is the coach shows different recipes to swap out for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I actually like a lot of the recipes. The thing is that with most of the recipes, they don't give you the amounts for some of the foods like oz, tbl, tsps, nothing. So how can you make the recipe and keep the calorie count in check if you don't know how much of an ingredient to add to the recipe? Then the breakfast, lunch, and dinner suggestions in the coach section (which only works if you buy the pro version) do not add up to your particular calorie allotment for the day. So my allotment is supposed to be 3 meals a day @ 1,800 calories with no snacks. That is 900 calories per meal. The coach section has suggestions of meals that equal 450 calories and some of the suggestions are just for things like keto bread for 250 calories. I need 900 calories per meal. Show me those, not 250 or 400 calorie meals or just parts of meals Who is just going to eat some slices of bread for lunch or dinner? Not me for sure. If they would fix these parts of the app, I could use this app for years to come. This app in its current state is totally uselesss to me and I suspect some others. Please fix this. I cancelled my subscription and will rejoin if you fix it.
title: Wanted to like this, but

review:
I’m be been using this app for about 1.5 months now, and I have enjoyed it. I’ve used MyFitnessPal, Lifesum and other competitive apps but ended up preferring this one, for several reasons. 

Here’s some things they do well:

- No need to sign-in: your data is private (unlike MyFitnessPal, who sells you like cattle), and integrates with Apple Health wonderfully
- Helpful notifications that don’t feel irksome! They really focus on your health, instead of marketing to you. 
- Very understandable interface: I never feel lost in the app
- Siri integration makes it easy to add food without navigating the app. I use this feature extensively!

Here’s a few things that I’d like to see improve:

- Measurements for a meal seem unnatural: the base measurement is set to 1 oz. This is a helpful measurement overall, but it would make more sense for a single serving size to be the default meal size.
- Adding a new food to the database feels tedious. I’m sorry for being nebulous here, but when adding nutritional information from a cooking website or using nutrition panel for a purchased meal/restaurant website, it would be much easier to input accurate information if the app more closely mirrored the source, specifically with regards to serving size options. 
- The food database is still maturing, so finding a decent match to a meal can be a bit of a chore, and there are many duplicates with incomplete info. That can sometimes throw you off your calorie tracking. 

Keep up the great work, YAZIO team.
title: Smart app - food database needs work

review: Love it
title: Love it

review:
… if the functionality met my expectations based on initial use of the platform. I love the set up, I love the themes, I love the widget options, and I love that it is a food AND fasting tracker. The presentation is really gorgeous, and I love that the fasting timer keeps me informed at what stage I’m at. I want so badly for this app to work for me. 

But the fasting timer leaves so much to be desired. When you want to manually enter your time, you hit hard stops and have to go in and adjust the start or stop time several times over. For example, I start my fast time. I’m set for a 20:4 fast. I start the fast at 10pm - it’s hard stopping so that I can’t have a fast end time any later than 3:59pm. 4pm rolls around, I still am fasting, and my tracker says I’m eating. I then have to go in and manually adjust my fast end time - but still reach hard stops. This is a MAJOR flaw, there have been requests to adjust it in the app FAQ, and considering how smooth other fasting trackers work, I don’t see how this can’t have been addressed already. 

Additionally, the food database is relatively weak. The serving sizes in the app don’t correlate with serving sizes for some of the scanned items. For example: one serving of peanut butter is 2 tablespoons by the nutrition label. Tracker automatically sets to 1 serving - but the calorie information for 1 “serving” is actually 2 servings worth (190 calories for 1 serving on nutrition label; 380 calories for 1 serving on app). I’ve noticed this with many different barcodes I’ve scanned, and I’ve just wound up adjusting calories to what the nutrition label serving size indicates. This is cumbersome and feels like it shouldn’t be so. Also, a large amount of servings seem to revert to “1 ounce,” but there’s no good reason for this - it’s almost never actually a 1 ounce serving. This can seriously impact those who don’t pay attention and wind up thinking they’re eating more or less calories than they actually are. 

There should also be some sort of toggle to view extra calories allotted for activity or just to keep a straight calorie limit regardless of activity. I wind up with way more calories than I need at the end of the day and if I’m not undershooting my recommended intake after my activity has been accounted for, I’m plateauing weight wise. 

I haven’t decided if I’m going to continue my subscription to this app. I love it on SO many levels, and when I first found it it looked like exactly what I wanted - fasting and food tracking in one place. If they addressed some of these issues - which seem like basic and intuitive things for what the app intends - I would hands down be 5 star happy with this. I want to be. There are so many great aspects of this app - but these issues are kind of a big deal for how the app is expected to perform.

review:
I’ve used MyFitnessPal, LoseIt and Yazio and Yazio is the worst of the bunch. The food database is the smallest by far so I find myself having to add food more often than not. On top of that, the foods that are in the database almost always have incorrect serving / portion sizes. This may be because the interface for entering a new food is really weird and bad. It seems impossible to have the app understand what a serving is. And, if you enter one incorrectly (due to the bad interface, probably) and make it public, there is no option at all to edit or remove it.  

Another quirk related to portion sizes is that the app doesn’t offer many conversions for you when adding food that already exists in the database. For instance, if it says “ounces” on an item, you can’t change that to grams. This, combined with the fact that the portion size in the app is almost certainly wrong, often had me just typing in numbers randomly until the calories lined up with what I’d expect. 

I made the mistake of purchasing a pro account because a lot of these issues were less apparent in the first few days (and they were offering a deal on subscriptions). I definitely regret it, but they’re pretty transparent on their website that they don’t offer refunds (and, since I purchased through them and not the App Store I really have no recourse). 

I’d recommend staying away from this one and trying one of the options I mentioned above instead. The interface is cool and unique, but the actual functionality is lacking.
title: Not great

review:
I’ve been no stranger to calorie counting or meal prep, and have used a variety of apps. This one is by far the worst. The free version is basically useless, and I tried upgrading to the paid version thinking it would be better. Wrong!

So the paid version provides meal plans. This means it gives you recipes. I got two a day. A sample menu as laid out in this app for me in a full day includes no breakfast, whole wheat rolls for lunch (~200 calories) and a quinoa and fruit bowl for dinner (~300 calories). And it constantly sends me reminders to drink water if I’m hungry. Seriously? At 500 calories a day with basically no protein, no vegetables, and no fat of course I’d be starving. The point of this is to stay healthy, not starve myself. 

The food list only allows you to input most foods in ounces. A pat of butter? Better figure it out in ounces! Half an Apple? Nope, ounces. A teaspoon of anything? You won’t be able to find it. There’s an option to scan a barcode but I haven’t scanned a single item in my entire kitchen that came up correctly. My fitness pal is free and has way better functionality. 

I’m also a picky eater. I tried to swap the recipes but it would only cycle through the same 5 meals. For the week. None of them looked appealing and in most cases were not appropriate for meals. Who eats just rye bread for dinner? I’ve already cancelled the subscription and have been trying to get my money back for days, but the customer service department seems even more pointless than the app. Don’t waste your time. Stick with literally any other app out there. I’ll be going back to MFP.
title: Don’t waste your time

For example my carbs are set to 192g which is 768 calories (4calories per gram) but that app displays that as being 785 calories.  Another thing is I wish that you were able to revise a food that you create. title: Disappointed

review: The food database is small, and adding foods is painful and likely leads to the inaccuracies other users have complained of. I tried to log a bagel first thing. It wasn't in the database, even though it was from a huge chain with easily accessible nutrition info. To add it, I had to categorize it (either a bread or a roll, imo), enter its mass, and input its macro- and micronutrients. Micronutrients included both salt and sodium (!), which had to be entered in units of grams (!!), and the usual complement of vitamins, minerals, and metals, which had to be entered in mg (!!!). These are ludicrous choices that make one wonder how knowledgeable the app builders are. They also ensure that user-input foods will essentially all have inaccurate data, since people are unlikely to put in the effort to get everything in the units the app wants.

review: The app has good health and fasting information. Keeps logs for you in numerous areas, weight activity etc. But you need to connect to another app you have for that.There is a recipe section which if you are vegetarian may appeal to you. I’ve tried a handful of recipes and they are not bad just needed ingredients I do not typically have. The app has a barcode scanner which is helpful , however the information often contradicts itself. Particularly in the quantity/ calorie area. Annoying but you can sort of figure it out I just feel I shouldn’t have to. The epic fail of the program is the inability to get real information on your vitamin and mineral intake. I take supplements, the app reads the barcode no problem, but DOES NOT add the ingredients to your list. So what is the point? A terrible flaw which I had to pay money to find out. Hopefully you don’t.
title: Has some good information, but overall disappointing.

review:
I love YAZIO and it has completely revolutionized my eating habits with the support of the Apple Watch I got for Christmas. Unfortunately, there are several issues that have wasted hours of my time and created many headaches for me. Given the price of the app, I expected more: 

- Completely broken Apple Watch complications that show only the logo.

- Imprecise recipes that have quantities listed by ounce instead of by cups, teaspoons, and the like. Some quantities are so small that they show up as 0 oz which gives no clue about how much of the ingredient to add. 

- Broken per meal calorie allotments that show only zeroes for each recommended amount. 

- Inability to add certain types of nutritional information (e.g. added sugar) when creating new foods.

- No quality control/review process for user added foods. Most of the time, I create a new version of each food from scratch because 8 times out of 10, the user-contributed one is inaccurate. 

- I would have preferred to send this all to a support line/customer service representative to get help, but they don’t seem to have any such thing. The support link takes you to an incomplete FAQ page with no way to problem solve or get feedback from an actual human. That’s a big red flag, and something I hope they remedy in the future. 

As a US-based user, I understand that some of the issues with the app might have to do with the fact that it is geared toward a German/international audience. The app has already been so helpful to me, and it has the potential to be great if they expand their features to make it more compatible with US measurements etc.
title: Would love to love this, but the bugs make it impossible

review:
Looked good at first. However, I can’t bring myself to support a company that uses sly bait and switch tactics to get people to buy their product. 

When you first set up YAZIO through the apple App Store, and go through the initial steps to set up, it brings you to select “pro” or standard. Pro has a standard price of $29.99 when purchasing through the app with no trial and standard is free. I decided to wait until I did more research. Then YAZIO sent me a discount coupon to my email somehow, even though I didn’t select to receive emails from them. It was a coupon for 20% off. I clicked it and it took me to their website where they try to show that their standard price for Pro is $3.75 per month but it’s on sale for $3.00. Well that equals $36 a year. So apparently the 20% “discount” ends up costing you $6 more than through the app. Otherwise known as “bait and switch tactics”. The developers figure this will go right over your head. Not the end of the world over $6, but not honest business. Unfortunately, I won’t be doing business with them and apple should know that they are leading others away from their site with these deceitful tactics. Just felt others should be aware. 

I have screenshots to share but don’t know how to do that in these reviews.
title: Bait and switch tactics. Not honest business.

review: I feel like this app wouldn’t be a bad app, but it definitely isn’t worth the $30 that I accidentally paid to have a yearly subscription. I was scrolling through the instructions for the app mindlessly because I was tired after a long day. All of a sudden the Face ID screen popped up, I thought it was a little weird, but I was tired so I automatically double clicked the power button. Then a message appeared thanking me for my purchase... I was shocked to find out that the app had charged me $29.99 for a “pro” subscription. I looked around the app thinking maybe the pro subscription would be beneficial, but I was wrong. The pro subscription is something you could get on another app for free, so I contacted the app’s support to try to get a refund. The company replied saying that I had made a binding contract with them, so they couldn’t refund my accidental purchase. The response from customer service was also very automated, I doubt a living person actually read my concern. Anyway, I’m upset that I paid 30 whole dollars for nothing special. I DO NOT recommend this app to anyone. Find another free app that doesn’t trick you into giving them money :)
title: Disappointed, upset, and $30 poorer than I was before YAZIO

review:
I like this app and what it has to offer but it is limited by its “free database” basically what you get for free. So I wanted to buy pro for this app and that is where the confusion had happened. There are three plans that you can get. One of the was $22.49 for three months and because I am $.49 poor I couldn’t afford that so I did some reading. It’s called “Yazio food and diet subscription for 3 months” so next I went to the App Store to see what the in app purchases were. On the very top of the page I saw “Yazio calorie tracker pro for 3 months” this was $19.99! Which I could afford. But here’s the thing, the titles were different. So are these 3 month subscriptions the same or are they completely different.
  Now don’t get me wrong this app is really good and is my number one choice for a dieting app but I would like to know if those 3 month subscriptions are the same before I spend $20 on this app. Also what happened to the monthly subscriptions?

-Chris
title: I am very confused...

developerResponse.body:
Hi!

The Fitbit data should be definitely correct. It works fine for thousands of users, as you can see in the positive reviews. If your friend thinks there are any errors, she/he should send us screenshots of the Fitbit dashboard and the YAZIO diary. Then we'll look into it.
If your friend subscribed to PRO via Apple iTunes, we are simply not able to proceed with refunds. A refund can only be given by iTunes. Apple is not providing any possibility to developers to issue refunds.

If there are further questions, don't hesitate to contact us at help@yazio.com.

Your YAZIO team
